sentences.sContent: Riskier investments tend to be counterbalanced by high rewards.
sentences.sCn: 较高风险的投资往往报以高回报。

sentences.sContent: ...organizations set up as a counterbalance to groups allied to the ANC.
sentences.sCn: ...作为对与非洲人国民大会联盟团体制衡而成立的各种组织。

remMethod.val: counter(相反的) + balance(平衡) → 相反的两边保持平衡 → 使平衡

words.tran: 平衡；对重平衡；补偿；均衡化

trans.tranOther: to have an equal and opposite effect to something such as a change, feeling etc

trans.tranCn: 平衡量， 平衡力； 势均力敌
trans.tranOther: Something that is a counterbalance to something else counterbalances that thing
